Characters.Name: Resai Jewel
Characters.Apparance: Mostly human. She had purple hair that fades to blue at the ends. She has cat ears and a tail that are purple. She also has green cat eyes.

Characters.Name: Whiskey Dabrewer
Characters.Apparance: She has red hair and green eyes. Gray skin and clan tattoos on her thigh and chest above her right breast.
Characters.Personality: She likes to dance and tell people stories about her god and what ever else she can.

Characters.Name: Jamala
Characters.Apparance: Brown hair, golden eyes, clan tattoo on her cheek, Fey tattoo on her stomach.
Characters.Personality: Must start and end her day off praying to her god. She is slow to trust. Finds non-Orcs to be beautiful.
Characters.Backstory: As a child, I had an encounter with some Fey and I haven’t been the same since. I was marked by the fey with a tattoo on my stomach and I didn’t feel like I fit in with my tribe anymore so I left to wander the world and find my place.

Characters.Name: Damaia Auburn Vanan
Characters.Apparance: Pink skin with green eyes. Auburn hair with purple streaks.
Characters.Backstory:
You’re here…Fuck... I guess you want me to tell you my story… Fine, but you gotta buy me a drink first, and the rest of my drinks while I tell you my story. Don’t look at me like that. Get your ass to the bar and get me an ale. 
 Welcome back. Now give me that ale… Ohh that hits the spot. Where to begin? I guess with my name. I’m Damaia Vanan but most people call me Auburn on a count of my hair. I’m the daughter of Barakaus Vanan, my father, and Rieta Sedlak, my mother. 
 My parents were both Tieflings of the Zariel bloodline. My father worked as an adventurer and my mother was…  or is a merchant… I guess. I haven’t seen her in a few years, she’s a bitch. But let's talk about my father for a bit. He told me that when he met my mother he fell in love. He courted her and soon they married. A few years later they had me. My father loved me and gave up going on adventures to be home with me and my mother, which hurt my mother’s business because she could no longer sell the items he had been bringing home. She divorced him when I was around 5 or 6 years old. She remarried very quickly, looking back on it she might have been having an affair. The man she married was a human-pig named Brutus Wolgang. He was a noble and was able to help her business grow more. He died when I was 10. I have one step-brother from that marriage, Percy Wolgang, and two step-sisters, Serina Wolgang and Helania Wolgang. 
 From that time on my time was split between my father and mother. My step-siblings being older than me would bully me. My mother had me working in her store all day long. Whenever my step-sisters came to the store to visit they would break things and then blame me. I would be punished by my mother. By the time I was 14 my mother started to keep me away from my father and would not let me see him. I was forced to work longer hours and do more things around the store while my step-siblings got to go about their normal noble lives. 
 I was frustrated with how I was being treated by my mother and step-siblings. So I ran away and went to find my father. 
 After I returned to my father and told him what had happened to me, he started to train me to fight and use weapons so I could protect myself in the future. So this couldn’t happen to me anymore.
 When I was 16 I started working for the city guard, with my father. Just before I turned 17 I started to date Seirye Willowrun. After about six months I would spend some nights at her house and other nights she would sleep at my house. 
 After I turned 18 my father got very sick. As he lay dying he gave me a letter for his youngest sister, Makaria D’mone in Gallow’s End. Shortly afterward he died. After the funeral, I went to see Seirye. When I entered her house I could hear the sounds of her moans coming from the bedroom, I knew these sounds well as I had made her moan like that many times before, and there were clothes on the floor, and some of the clothes were not hers. 
 I quietly opened the door to see her on her back with a man between her legs. She was moaning from what he was doing to her. I quietly left her house and returned to my father’s house, which was now mine. I packed my things and headed to my captain’s office to let him know that I had to make a trip to Gallow’s End and I wasn’t sure when I would be back. Then I left Telmarand. 
 Now go get me another ale, my bitch! My throat is parched.

Lores.Title: Skymoore Tree
Lores.Summary: One of the tallest trees on Re'Arth.
Lores.Information: Skymoore trees stand between 300 to 400 feet tall when fully grown. Their leaves are shades of white and gray. Their bark is blue, purple or gray.

Lores.Title: Dragonborn
Lores.Summary: The history of the dragonborn and their stats.

Lores.Title: Elves
Lores.Summary: How the elves came to be.
Lores.Information:
Elf
During the Sundering of the world, the humans that took refugee in the forests of the world were changed into Elves. The rampaging magic created a connection between the trees and the newly formed Elves. Their skin, eyes, and hair colors changed to resemble the bark and leaves colors of the trees. They build their cities as part of the forest. 

They have a grace that is otherworldly, their forest cities are filled with soft music and art.  

Elves don’t use metal for armor, weapons, or tools. They don’t cut down trees, they communicate with the trees and ask the tree to shape itself into what they want to make using magic. Once the tree has shaped the tool they need, the crafters use magic to strengthen the wood to be as hard as metal. 

Most Elves think that axes are an abhorrent weapon to use because their primary usage is to cut down trees. 

Elves do not celebrate the birth of their children, but the conception of children. Elven women know when they have conceived of a child. 

All Elves get the following abilities:
Ability Score Increase: +2 to Dexterity. 

Age: Elves age at about half the speed of humans reaching physical maturity around 36 years old. They are not viewed as adults till around 100 years old and can live to be around 750 to 1000 years old. 

Size: Elves range from under 5 feet to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Their size is Medium.

Speed: Their base walking speed is 30 feet.

Darkvision: Accustomed to twilit forests and the night sky, Elves have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. Elves can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. Elves can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray. 

Connection to the trees: Elves have an advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can’t elves to sleep. 

Trance: Elves do not sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semi-conscious, for 4 hours a day. The Common word for this meditation is "trance." While meditating, they dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive after years of practice. After resting in this way, they gain the same benefit a human would from 8 hours of sleep. 

Keen Senses: Elves have proficiency in the Perception skill.

Languages: Elves speak, read and write, Elven and Common.

Lores.Title: Elves: Ashfire
Lores.Information:
Their skin is shades of white and grey. Their eyes and hair are shades of yellow, orange, and red. Many Ashfire elves worship Kal’Bal’La, the God of NIght. 
 
Ability Score Increase. Your Wisdom score increases by 1.

Incisive Sense. You have an advantage on Investigation and Insight checks.

Gift of Kal’Bal’La. Ashfire elves know the Light cantrip. When they reach 3rd level, they can cast Sleep once, and it recharges after a long rest. When they reach 5th level, they can cast Invisibility (Self Only) once, and it recharges after a long rest. You do not need the material components required of the spells. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

Lores.Title: Elves: Blight Forest
Lores.Information:
Their skin is dark gray to black. Their eye color is shades of white and gray as is their hair. 

Ability Score Increase. +1 Charisma

Superior Darkvision. Their darkvision has a range of 120 feet, instead of 60.

Sunlight Sensitivity. They have disadvantages on attack rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of the attack, or whatever they are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight.

Drow Magic. They know the Dancing Lights cantrip. When they reach 3rd level, you can cast the Faerie Fire spell once with this trait and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. When they reach 5th level, they can cast the Darkness spell once and regain the ability to do so when you finish a long rest. Charisma is their spellcasting ability for these spells.

Blight Weapon Training. You have proficiency with Scimitar, Kukri, and hand crossbows.

Lores.Title: Elves: Fallen
Lores.Information:
They have for whatever reason no longer lived in a forest and have started to live with humans or another race. Their connection to the trees has weakened. If they were to go live in a forest their children would be connected to the trees of that forest.  Their appearance is like humans with skin, eyes, and hair colors.

Ability Score Increase. Your Charisma score increases by 2, and two other ability scores of your choice each increase by 1. This replaces the Ability Score Increase from being an elf. 

Skill Versatility. You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

Languages. One additional language of your choice.

Lores.Title: Elves: Ironwood
Lores.Information:
Their skin is shades of brown. Their hair and eyes are shades of green and brown.  The Emporer commands the Ironwood Empire. 

Ability Score Increase. +1 Intelligence.

Cantrip. They know one cantrip of your choice from the Wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

Ironwood Weapon Training. They have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

Extra Language. They can read, speak, and write one additional language of their choice.

Lores.Title: Elves: Skymoore
Lores.Information:
Their skin and eyes are shades of blue and purple. Their hair is white and greys. They have a feudal style of government and embrace a code of honor. They use a single edge curved blade sword called Diasho. They wear silk robes. Their diet consists of fish, rice, and vegetables. 

Ability Score Increase. +1 Intelligence.

Skymoore Weapon Training. Skymoore Elves have proficiency with the katana, wakizashi, shortbow, and longbow.

Shadow Step: They can cast the Misty Step spell once using this trait. They regain the ability to do so when they finish a short or long rest.

Lores.Title: Elves:Rosewood
Lores.Information:
Their skin is shades of green. Their eyes and hair are shades of white, red, and pink.

Ability Score Increase. +1 Wisdom.

Ashfire Weapon Training. They have proficiency with the Warhammer, Light Hammer, shortbow, and longbow.

Fleet of Foot. Their base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

Mask of the Wild. You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

Items.Name: Rope, Hempen (50 feet)
Items.Description: Rope, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

Items.Name: Plate
Items.Description: Plate consists of shaped, interlocking metal plates to cover the entire body. A suit of plate includes gauntlets, heavy leather boots, a visored helmet, and thick layers of padding underneath the armor. Buckles and straps distribute the weight over the body.

Items.Name: Demon Armor
Items.Description:
Requires Attunement

While wearing this armor, you gain a +1 bonus to AC, and you can understand and speak Abyssal. In addition, the armor's clawed gauntlets turn unarmed strikes with your hands into magic Weapons that deal slashing damage, with a +1 bonus to Attack rolls and Damage Rolls and a damage die of 1d8.

Curse: Once you don this Cursed armor, you can't doff it unless you are targeted by the Remove Curse spell or similar magic. While wearing the armor, you have disadvantage on Attack rolls against Demons and on Saving Throws against their Spells and Special Abilities.

Items.Name: Potion of Greater Healing
Items.Description: You regain hit points when you drink this potion. The number of hit points depends on the potion’s rarity, as shown in the Potions of Healing table. Whatever its potency, the potion’s red liquid glimmers when agitated.

Items.Name: Potion of Healing
Items.Description: You regain hit points when you drink this potion. The number of hit points depends on the potion’s rarity, as shown in the Potions of Healing table. Whatever its potency, the potion’s red liquid glimmers when agitated.

Items.Name: Rod of Lordly Might
Items.Description:
Requires Attunement

This rod has a flanged head, and it functions as a magic mace that grants a +3 bonus to Attack and damage roll made with it. The rod has Properties associated with six different buttons that are set in a row along the haft. It has three other Properties as well, detailed below.

Six Buttons: You can press one of the rod's six buttons as a Bonus Action. A button's Effect lasts until you push a different button or until you push the same button again, which causes the rod to revert to its normal form.

If you press button 1, the rod becomes a Flame Tongue as a fiery blade sprouts from the end opposite the rod's flanged head.

If you press button 2, the rod's flanged head folds down and two crescent-shaped blades spring out, transforming the rod into a magic Battleaxe that grants a +3 bonus to Attack and Damage Rolls made with it.

If you press button 3, the rod's flanged head folds down, a spear point springs from the rod's tip, and the rod's handle lengthens into a 6-foot haft, transforming the rod into a magic spear that grants a+3 bonus to Attack and Damage Rolls made with it.

If you press button 4, the rod transforms into a climbing pole up to 50 feet long, as you specify. In surfaces as hard as granite, a spike at the bottom and three hooks at the top anchor the pole. Horizontal bars 3 inches long fold out from the sides, 1 foot apart, forming a Ladder. The pole can bear up to 4,000 pounds. More weight or lack of solid anchoring causes the rod to revert to its normal form.

If you press button 5, the rod transforms into a handheld battering ram and gram its user a +10 bonus to Strength checks made to break through doors, barricades, and other barriers.

If you press button 6, the rod assumes or remains in its normal form and indicates magnetic north. (Nothing happens if this function of the rod is used in a Location that has no magnetic north.) The rod also gives you knowledge of your approximate depth beneath the ground or your height above it.

Drain Life: When you hit a creature with a melee Attack using the rod, you can force the target to make a DC 17 Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target rakes an extra 4d6 necrotic damage, and you regain a number of Hit Points equal to half that necrotic damage. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Paralyze: When you hit a creature with a melee Attack using the rod, you can force the target to make a DC 17 Strength saving throw. On a failure, the target is Paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, Ending the Effect on a success. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Terrify: While holding the rod, you can use an action to force each creature you can see within 30 feet of you to make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, a target is Frightened of you for 1 minute. A Frightened target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, Ending the Effect on itself on a success. This property can't be used again until the next dawn.

Items.Name: Longsword
Items.Description: Proficiency with a longsword allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.

Items.Name: Shortsword
Items.Description: Proficiency with a shortsword allows you to add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll for any attack you make with it.
